meanings.definition: A system of government or rule by three individuals.
meanings.sent1: In some ancient societies, trierarchies were responsible for leading the people.
meanings.sent2: The trierarchies worked together to make important decisions for their community.
meanings.sent3: The trierarchies held meetings every week to discuss new rules and laws.
meanings.sent4: The balance of power in the trierarchies ensured fair governance.
meanings.sent5: The trierarchies' unity was crucial for the stability of the nation.

meanings.definition: The office or position of a trierarch.
meanings.sent1: He was honored to be appointed to the trierarchies in his town.
meanings.sent2: The trierarchies were respected members of the council.
meanings.sent3: The trierarchies' office had a beautiful view of the city's harbor.
meanings.sent4: Being part of the trierarchies meant taking on great responsibilities.
meanings.sent5: The trierarchies' duties required dedication and leadership skills.

meanings.sent1: The trierarchies gathered for a special ceremony to celebrate their unity.
meanings.sent2: The trierarchies' decisions were always made after thorough discussions.
meanings.sent3: The trierarchies' friendship extended beyond their official roles.
meanings.sent4: The trierarchies' bond grew stronger with each challenge they faced.
meanings.sent5: The trierarchies' collaboration led to positive changes in the community.
